channel.title: Startup Example Docs & Failure Timeline of Flowtab
channel.description:
Saw this post on Tech Crunch, [The Decline And Fall Of Flowtab, A Startup Story][1]. Its a long read but valuable insights to hear.
Even more important than the story, I was pleasantly surprised to see that Flowtab actually is [sharing all of it's documents & materials][2] they used (pitch deck, sales sheets, etc) with the startup community-at-large. There's also a great timeline which offers a much more simple explanation of their rise and fall.
Really cool IMHO because its always nice to see how other folks are doing it. Of course, it goes without saying that you might not want to use the documents of a failed startup to try and establish your own successful one, but surely there's some gold in that dirt.
Cheers!
[1]: http://techcrunch.com/2013/08/31/the-decline-and-fall-of-flowtab-a-startup-story/ [2]: http://alpha.flowtab.com/

item.title: Startup Example Docs & Failure Timeline of Flowtab
item.dc:creator: kaptanuj
item.description:
Hi,

Looks like the page is offline. I am assuming I am late in reading this. If by any chance you or the readers have downloaded the docs, would you be able to email me?

Thanks a ton in advance
Tanuj

Read full topic

item.title: Startup Example Docs & Failure Timeline of Flowtab
item.dc:creator: schutzsmith
item.description:
Saw this post on Tech Crunch, The Decline And Fall Of Flowtab, A Startup Story. Its a long read but valuable insights to hear.

Even more important than the story, I was pleasantly surprised to see that Flowtab actually is sharing all of it’s documents & materials they used (pitch deck, sales sheets, etc) with the startup community-at-large. There’s also a great timeline which offers a much more simple explanation of their rise and fall.

Really cool IMHO because its always nice to see how other folks are doing it. Of course, it goes without saying that you might not want to use the documents of a failed startup to try and establish your own successful one, but surely there’s some gold in that dirt.

Cheers!
